content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a possible implementation for the `extract_julia_code` function:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia(.|\n)*?```", md)) # find all code blocks
    codes = []
    for block in blocks
        code = replace(block.captures[1], r"(?<=\n)`|`(?=\n)" => "") # remove first and last `
        push!(codes, code)
    end
    return join(codes, "\n") # concatenate all codes with newline
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown` package in Julia to parse the markdown document. It collects all code blocks that are identified by the presence of "julia" after three backticks (i.e., ````julia). For each code block, it removes the backticks at the beginning and end of the block and stores the remaining code in an array. Finally, it concatenates all the code blocks into a single string with newline characters between them.
